name: places/ChIJJY1dE79YwokRGUIQcJ7hJZU
formattedAddress: 425 W 121st St APT 807, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 425 W 121st St APT 807, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
He's an ideal LSAT tutor - his personality encourages you but also makes learning fun, and his deep knowledge of the LSAT makes for quality tutoring.

We all care about numbers, and I went from something like 155 to 169 on my first test, with less than reasonable effort. I attribute this to him as everything he taught was clearly materially useful and had tangible effects when I took PTs.

He has the skills to help you meet your potential for this test. I ended up deciding against law school, but had I continued he would have helped me reach my goal.

The only issue is he is slightly expensive, but the best often is. He’s also a good dude.

originalText.text: Larkin is an outstanding teacher and mentor for anyone applying to law school. He is not only incredibly knowledgeable about the LSAT and the admissions process, but he makes a concerted effort to get to know his students, ensuring their progress is sustainable by encouraging personalized studying. His teaching style is based entirely on building skill, and the skills I gained are important for any future law student, regardless of the LSAT. When I started with Larkin, I had very little understanding of the admissions process due to my school's under-resourced pre-law program. By the time I took the test, I felt completely confident in my skills imparted by Larkin. I would definitely recommend Larkin to anyone looking to strengthen their LSAT school or applications, and I don't believe I would have the same success without his help.

originalText.text: Larkin was immensely helpful for me in so many ways. Above all, he was profoundly impactful in taking the time to understand me as a student, and in the process, helped me better understand myself within and outside the parameters of the test. Within the test, Larkin sharpened my skills and helped me better understand the context of the test to meaningfully leverage those skills. Outside of it, he aptly identified and took the time to work through my psyche around the test and unlock my skillset even more, improving my performance on the test as well as my enjoyment of the studying process. Ultimately, I believe Larkin's support was the difference in helping me achieve the score I did and I'd recommend him ten times over to anyone.

originalText.text:
I cannot recommend Larkin enough. This is a man who is a master of his craft. Many people try to help you “crack” the lsat, as if it’s some puzzle that can be solved with a few secret tips and tricks. Larkin’s philosophy runs completely counter to that. He rightfully believes that to be best prepared for the lsat you need to learn the skills that the test is testing for. Those skills are critical thinking, and Larkin’s craft is teaching you how to critically think.

I skipped the whole process of doing self-directed study and worked with Larkin from the start. As a result I only had to take the test once after 3 months of studying. Together we established a great foundation for my skill set and fine tuned the places where I could improve. He has a method of teaching and calmness that really motivated me to do the best I could. And from the start I thought he had my best intentions in mind. I am incredibly happy with my score, but the only sad thing about this is that I’m not going to be seeing Larking as often as I was.

originalText.text: It's rare to find a tutor like Larkin, who is both incredibly knowledgeable and fun to work with. Larkin really is an expert on the LSAT and law school admissions, and he is also very understanding and skilled at personalizing your study process. When I started studying for the LSAT, I didn't think I was going to be able to get the score I wanted. Larkin was able to focus in on the areas I had trouble with, but he also gave me the confidence that I actually did have the skills I needed to improve. With his help, I ended up being admitted into my first choice school.
